p: Inadequate water supply and poor sanitation and hygiene practices remain a significant challenge throughout Ghana and many people suffer from water-related diseases such as malaria, diarrhoea and cholera as a result [ 19]. For the country to find and implement lasting solutions to these problems, it will be necessary to identify the main sources of water supply for communities and simultaneously examine aspects of their quality and quantity and threats to their safety in the context of consumptive use.
